main event: A civilian reported seeing a single unidentified object over Duluth, Minnesota for 3-5 minutes on December 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared to increase in size and brightness as it approached, then suddenly expanded greatly in size and gave off a brilliant white flash, illuminating the surrounding area.
The object then appeared to spin on its axis for about 30 seconds before accelerating rapidly, gaining altitude and disappearing to the southeast.
Several attempts were made to scramble aircraft to investigate the sighting, but none were airborne at the time.
The tower operator estimated the object was at least 50,000 feet in altitude and traveling at an extremely high rate of speed when it departed.
The report concluded that there was insufficient data to draw a conclusion about the nature of the unidentified object.
